reviews.review_msg: You can tell he really cares about what he's teaching. He has a very calm presence and is genuinely interested by his student's reflections, which is why there's quite a bit of homework. I found the material really interesting and inspiring, and the tests were easy if you read the textbook

Literally the worst class I've taken so far (4th yr student with a 3.4gpa, not amazing but I'm not an idiot). Be prepared to read 100 pages of religious texts/philosophy etc. Weekly quizzes will be extremely specific and based only on readings and not the lecture so you better memorize every little detail of those 100 pages.   Do not recommend

It's an easy class. Just study the vocab list and know the basics of each religion for the midterm and final. The reflection and essay are really good for boosting your marks. You also have to do homework assignments for each tutorial, which can be tedious. The lectures are sometimes boring, but he's a really sweet and passionate prof.
Seems interested in topic but boring lectures. Tests are easy if you study all of the vocabulary words.

Good GPA booster, not the type of course I wanted to take, nor do I necessarily feel like I've learned a lot from the course.  A lot of unnecessary worksheets but worth taking if you need the grade bump. Really nice prof, if you're interested in the humanities it would likely be more appealing.
A lot of work for 10% participation mark, including weekly reading assignments and a boring field trip. Exams are pretty fair.
Semi interesting course. Focuses too much on eastern religions. Tests were fair, but the textbook sucked (it assumed you were an idiot at times, very condescending).

One of the worst classes I've ever taken. Nice enough person and tries to make things interesting, but his exams weren't really fair (said to study one thing, tested on another) and the amount of work and reading required was excessive for a first year course. Lots of make work assignments (like reading q's for no marks).

calm and mellow. Unfortunately extremely forgettable also; nothing in lecture really sticks because of it. Doesn't make material particularly interesting--on the whole, his classes are relatively monotonous.

He's so calm...so patient. Really nice, answers all the questions thoroughly. i thought the amount of work needed was a bit much for a 1st year course. The project didn't worth much but took a lot of work. Tests weren't that good, asked about things i didn't think were important, like tiny details, nothing on major/central concepts/beliefs
By far my favorite class at SFU to date. Gordan is so funny, really passionate about the material and classes are very enjoyable! His exams are super easy as long as you do the readings.
easy marker; very helpful if u visit his office hours; if u only read the textbook u can get an A easily!
